name: Vegan Enchiladas
description: These vegan enchiladas with black beans and bell peppers are super delicious and satisfying! And they are really easy to make, so they make a great weeknight dinner for the whole family!
recipeIngredient: 3  bell peppers  ((I used different red, yellow, and green ones))
6  large corn tortillas or several smaller ones
2 tablespoons olive oil or canola oil
2  tablespoons all-purpose flour or gluten-free flour blend

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the onion and cut the bell peppers into small pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the onion and cut the bell peppers into small pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some oil in a large pan and sauté the onion and the garlic for about 2-3 minutes. Then add the bell pepper and cook for another 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some oil in a large pan and sauté the onion and the garlic for about 2-3 minutes. Then add the bell pepper and cook for another 4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain and rinse the canned black beans or use home-cooked beans. Place them in a large bowl and mash them with a potato masher. Leave some beans intact for texture.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain and rinse the canned black beans or use home-cooked beans. Place them in a large bowl and mash them with a potato masher. Leave some beans intact for texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the onion, garlic, and bell pepper mixture to the mashed beans. Season with cumin, smoked paprika powder, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the onion, garlic, and bell pepper mixture to the mashed beans. Season with cumin, smoked paprika powder, lime juice, salt, and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the tortillas with the bean bell pepper mixture and roll them up.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill the tortillas with the bean bell pepper mixture and roll them up.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly spray a baking dish with non-stick spray. Place the enchiladas seam side down in the baking dish. Preheat your oven to 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly spray a baking dish with non-stick spray. Place the enchiladas seam side down in the baking dish. Preheat your oven to 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Now make the vegan enchilada sauce. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a large pan. Then add two tablespoons of flour and cook for about 2 minutes. Stir constantly and be careful not to burn it. Then add the crushed tomatoes and the spices. Cook for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Now make the vegan enchilada sauce. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a large pan. Then add two tablespoons of flour and cook for about 2 minutes. Stir constantly and be careful not to burn it. Then add the crushed tomatoes and the spices. Cook for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the enchilada sauce over the enchiladas and spread evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the enchilada sauce over the enchiladas and spread evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the enchiladas at 350 °F for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and green onions. If you don't like fresh cilantro, you can replace it with parsley. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the enchiladas at 350 °F for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and green onions. If you don't like fresh cilantro, you can replace it with parsley. Serve immediately.

keywords: how to make vegan enchiladas, vegan enchilada recipe, vegan enchiladas
